skill.name: write-app-change-log
skill.description: Generates and updates the latest app changelog based on git history since the last version tag.
skill.summary: Generates and updates the latest app changelog based on git history since the last version tag.
skill.author: AnySoftKeyboard

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill with no executable code. It contains only markdown documentation that defines how an AI should generate changelogs. No scripts, network calls, filesystem access beyond its own directory, or external command execution capabilities.

content.value_statement: Creating changelogs manually takes time and often misses important changes. This skill reads git commits since the last version tag, filters out infrastructure updates, and writes a professional changelog that matches your existing style.
actual_capabilities: Fetch latest git tags from remote repository
Identify the most recent version tag as base
Collect commits and their descriptions since the base tag
Filter commits to exclude infrastructure and CI/CD changes
Update the latest changelog file in existing format
limitations: Requires git repository with version tags
Only works with Android-style changelog directories (fastlane/metadata)
Cannot create new changelog file numbers automatically
Depends on existing changelog format to match style

use_cases.title: Automate release notes
use_cases.description: Generate consistent changelogs for each app release without manual copy-paste work.

use_cases.title: Keep users informed
use_cases.description: Create clear release notes that highlight features users care about, not technical updates.

use_cases.title: Standardize changelog format
use_cases.description: Ensure all releases follow the same style and structure automatically.

prompt_templates.title: Basic changelog
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a changelog for the current version based on git commits since the last version tag. Follow the SKILL.md instructions.

prompt_templates.title: Feature-focused
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a changelog that emphasizes new features and user-facing improvements. Filter out all infrastructure and maintenance commits.

prompt_templates.title: Bug fix summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate a changelog that prioritizes bug fixes and stability improvements. Include only commits that directly affect app behavior.

prompt_templates.title: Full automation
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the full changelog workflow: fetch tags, find base tag, collect commits, filter relevant changes, match existing style, and update the changelog file.

output_examples.input: Generate a changelog for the current release
output: Added dark mode support for system settings
Fixed keyboard crash when switching languages

best_practices: Run git fetch --tags before generating changelogs to ensure latest tags are available
Review the generated changelog for accuracy before publishing
Keep existing changelog files in the fastlane/metadata directory for reference
anti_patterns: Using the skill without fetching tags first - may miss recent version tags
Accepting generated changelogs without reviewing for accuracy
Running on repositories without proper version tagging

faq.question: What git commands does this skill use?
faq.answer: It uses git fetch --tags, git tag -l for listing tags, and git log for collecting commits between tags.

faq.question: What changelog format does it produce?
faq.answer: It matches the existing style in your fastlane/metadata/android/en-US/changelogs/ directory, typically a version header followed by bullet points.

faq.question: Can it work with non-Android projects?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for Android's fastlane changelog format but can be adapted for other projects with similar directory structures.

faq.question: How does it filter commits?
faq.answer: It excludes changes to .github/, scripts/, CI/CD files, Dockerfiles, and documentation. It includes app source code and user-facing changes.

faq.question: Is my git repository data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. The skill only reads git history locally. No data is sent anywhere or modified except the changelog file it updates.

faq.question: How is this different from git log?
faq.answer: Git log shows all commits. This skill filters noise, selects meaningful changes, and formats them professionally for end users.
